reviews.review_msg: this is a dry class with lots of writing assignments. The lectures are 3 hours long which is alot especially for a statistic course. All exam prep material were for the first 5 lectures, we had no practice questions for the other 11 lecs. Marking takes too long, going into the final, 50% of material wasn't graded yet

(BPK409)Starts with a little tutorial on coding that doesn't prepare you at all for the course. Tells you to figure out the coding yourself when you always run into problems because of outdated lab instructions. She and TA rarely give a direct answer but always give attitude. No final exam but a final oral and big project due a week after classes.

she starts the course (BPK 409) by saying "I'm going to assume you have no coding experience" then proceeds to never help you with coding. BPK 409 is a course where you teach yourself concepts that engineering students will tell you that you have no business learning for a basic coding class. she is very nice, but a terrible prof for 409. avoid.

Took a stats course with her, and although statistics is usually a pretty dry class to take, she made it enjoyable. Explained topics well, provided detailed videos for completing the labs, and was pretty positive/enthusiastic the entire semester.
